new-window.description: Emitted when the page requests to open a new window for a url. It could be requested by window.open or an external link like <a target='_blank'>. By default a new BrowserWindow will be created for the url. Calling event.preventDefault() will prevent creating new windows. In such case, the event.newGuest may be set with a reference to a BrowserWindow instance to make it used by the Electron's runtime.

options.name: options
options.description: The options which will be used for creating the new `BrowserWindow`.

additionalFeatures.name: additionalFeatures
additionalFeatures.description: The non-standard features (features not handled by Chromium or Electron) given to `window.open()`.

will-navigate.name: will-navigate
will-navigate.description: Emitted when a user or the page wants to start navigation. It can happen when the window.location object is changed or a user clicks a link in the page. This event will not emit when the navigation is started programmatically with APIs like webContents.loadURL and webContents.back. It is also not emitted for in-page navigations, such as clicking anchor links or updating the window.location.hash. Use did-navigate-in-page event for this purpose. Calling event.preventDefault() will prevent the navigation.

did-navigate.name: did-navigate
did-navigate.description: Emitted when a navigation is done. This event is not emitted for in-page navigations, such as clicking anchor links or updating the window.location.hash. Use did-navigate-in-page event for this purpose.

did-navigate-in-page.name: did-navigate-in-page
did-navigate-in-page.description: Emitted when an in-page navigation happened. When in-page navigation happens, the page URL changes but does not cause navigation outside of the page. Examples of this occurring are when anchor links are clicked or when the DOM hashchange event is triggered.

crashed.name: crashed
crashed.description: Emitted when the renderer process crashes or is killed.

plugin-crashed.name: plugin-crashed
plugin-crashed.description: Emitted when a plugin process has crashed.

devtools-focused.name: devtools-focused
devtools-focused.description: Emitted when DevTools is focused / opened.

certificate-error.name: certificate-error
certificate-error.description: Emitted when failed to verify the certificate for url. The usage is the same with the certificate-error event of app.

select-client-certificate.name: select-client-certificate
select-client-certificate.description: Emitted when a client certificate is requested. The usage is the same with the select-client-certificate event of app.

login.name: login
login.description: Emitted when webContents wants to do basic auth. The usage is the same with the login event of app.

found-in-page.name: found-in-page
found-in-page.description: Emitted when a result is available for webContents.findInPage request.

media-paused.name: media-paused
media-paused.description: Emitted when media is paused or done playing.

did-change-theme-color.name: did-change-theme-color
did-change-theme-color.description: Emitted when a page's theme color changes. This is usually due to encountering a meta tag:

update-target-url.name: update-target-url
update-target-url.description: Emitted when mouse moves over a link or the keyboard moves the focus to a link.

cursor-changed.name: cursor-changed
cursor-changed.description: Emitted when the cursor's type changes. The type parameter can be default, crosshair, pointer, text, wait, help, e-resize, n-resize, ne-resize, nw-resize, s-resize, se-resize, sw-resize, w-resize, ns-resize, ew-resize, nesw-resize, nwse-resize, col-resize, row-resize, m-panning, e-panning, n-panning, ne-panning, nw-panning, s-panning, se-panning, sw-panning, w-panning, move, vertical-text, cell, context-menu, alias, progress, nodrop, copy, none, not-allowed, zoom-in, zoom-out, grab, grabbing, custom. If the type parameter is custom, the image parameter will hold the custom cursor image in a NativeImage, and scale, size and hotspot will hold additional information about the custom cursor.

scale.name: scale
scale.description: (optional) - scaling factor for the custom cursor

hotspot.name: hotspot
hotspot.description: (optional) - coordinates of the custom cursor's hotspot

context-menu.name: context-menu
context-menu.description: The mediaFlags is an object with the following properties: The editFlags is an object with the following properties: Emitted when there is a new context menu that needs to be handled.

linkURL.name: linkURL
linkURL.description: URL of the link that encloses the node the context menu was invoked on.

linkText.name: linkText
linkText.description: Text associated with the link. May be an empty string if the contents of the link are an image.

pageURL.name: pageURL
pageURL.description: URL of the top level page that the context menu was invoked on.

frameURL.name: frameURL
frameURL.description: URL of the subframe that the context menu was invoked on.

srcURL.name: srcURL
srcURL.description: Source URL for the element that the context menu was invoked on. Elements with source URLs are images, audio and video.

mediaType.name: mediaType
mediaType.description: Type of the node the context menu was invoked on. Can be , , , , , or .

hasImageContents.name: hasImageContents
hasImageContents.description: Whether the context menu was invoked on an image which has non-empty contents.

selectionText.name: selectionText
selectionText.description: Text of the selection that the context menu was invoked on.

titleText.name: titleText
titleText.description: Title or alt text of the selection that the context was invoked on.

misspelledWord.name: misspelledWord
misspelledWord.description: The misspelled word under the cursor, if any.

frameCharset.name: frameCharset
frameCharset.description: The character encoding of the frame on which the menu was invoked.

inputFieldType.name: inputFieldType
inputFieldType.description: If the context menu was invoked on an input field, the type of that field. Possible values are , , , .

menuSourceType.name: menuSourceType
menuSourceType.description: Input source that invoked the context menu. Can be , , , , .

mediaFlags.name: mediaFlags
mediaFlags.description: The flags for the media element the context menu was invoked on. See more about this below.

editFlags.name: editFlags
editFlags.description: These flags indicate whether the renderer believes it is able to perform the corresponding action. See more about this below.

select-bluetooth-device.name: select-bluetooth-device
select-bluetooth-device.description: Emitted when bluetooth device needs to be selected on call to navigator.bluetooth.requestDevice. To use navigator.bluetooth api webBluetooth should be enabled.  If event.preventDefault is not called, first available device will be selected. callback should be called with deviceId to be selected, passing empty string to callback will cancel the request.

paint.name: paint
paint.description: Emitted when a new frame is generated. Only the dirty area is passed in the buffer.

image.name: image
image.description: The image data of the whole frame.

Debugger.name: Debugger
Debugger.description: An alternate transport for Chrome's remote debugging protocol.

attach.name: attach
attach.description: Attaches the debugger to the webContents.

returns.description: Whether a debugger is attached to the webContents.

detach.name: detach
detach.description: Detaches the debugger from the webContents.

sendCommand.name: sendCommand
sendCommand.description: Send given command to the debugging target.

method.name: method
method.description: Method name, should be one of the methods defined by the remote debugging protocol.

detach.name: detach
detach.description: Emitted when debugging session is terminated. This happens either when webContents is closed or devtools is invoked for the attached webContents.

message.name: message
message.description: Emitted whenever debugging target issues instrumentation event.

params.name: params
params.description: Event parameters defined by the 'parameters' attribute in the remote debugging protocol.

crash.name: crash
crash.description: Causes the main thread of the current process crash.

hang.name: hang
hang.description: Causes the main thread of the current process hang.

setFdLimit.name: setFdLimit
setFdLimit.description: Sets the file descriptor soft limit to maxDescriptors or the OS hard limit, whichever is lower for the current process.

getProcessMemoryInfo.name: getProcessMemoryInfo
getProcessMemoryInfo.description: Returns an object giving memory usage statistics about the current process. Note that all statistics are reported in Kilobytes.

properties.name: workingSetSize
properties.description: The amount of memory currently pinned to actual physical RAM.

properties.name: peakWorkingSetSize
properties.description: The maximum amount of memory that has ever been pinned to actual physical RAM.

properties.name: privateBytes
properties.description: The amount of memory not shared by other processes, such as JS heap or HTML content.

properties.name: sharedBytes
properties.description: The amount of memory shared between processes, typically memory consumed by the Electron code itself

getSystemMemoryInfo.name: getSystemMemoryInfo
getSystemMemoryInfo.description: Returns an object giving memory usage statistics about the entire system. Note that all statistics are reported in Kilobytes.

properties.name: total
properties.description: The total amount of physical memory in Kilobytes available to the system.

properties.name: free
properties.description: The total amount of memory not being used by applications or disk cache.

properties.name: swapTotal
properties.description: The total amount of swap memory in Kilobytes available to the system.

properties.name: swapFree
properties.description: The free amount of swap memory in Kilobytes available to the system.

loaded.name: loaded
loaded.description: Emitted when Electron has loaded its internal initialization script and is beginning to load the web page or the main script. It can be used by the preload script to add removed Node global symbols back to the global scope when node integration is turned off:

desktopCapturer.name: desktopCapturer
desktopCapturer.description:
Access information about media sources that can be used to capture audio and
video from the desktop using the navigator.webkitGetUserMedia API.

getSources.name: getSources
getSources.description: Starts gathering information about all available desktop media sources, and calls callback(error, sources) when finished. sources is an array of Source objects, each Source represents a screen or an individual window that can be captured, and has the following properties:

types.name: types
types.description: An array of Strings that lists the types of desktop sources to be captured, available types are and .

thumbnailSize.name: thumbnailSize
thumbnailSize.description: (optional) - The suggested size that the media source thumbnail should be scaled to, defaults to .

ipcRenderer.name: ipcRenderer
ipcRenderer.description: Communicate asynchronously from a renderer process to the main process.

remote.name: remote
remote.description: Use main process modules from the renderer process.

returns.description: The object returned by require(module) in the main process.
The BrowserWindow object to which this web page belongs.
The WebContents object of this web page.
The global variable of name (e.g. global[name]) in the main process.

webFrame.name: webFrame
webFrame.description: Customize the rendering of the current web page.

setZoomFactor.name: setZoomFactor
setZoomFactor.description: Changes the zoom factor to the specified factor. Zoom factor is zoom percent divided by 100, so 300% = 3.0.

returns.description: The current zoom factor.

setZoomLevel.name: setZoomLevel
setZoomLevel.description: Changes the zoom level to the specified level. The original size is 0 and each increment above or below represents zooming 20% larger or smaller to default limits of 300% and 50% of original size, respectively.

returns.description: The current zoom level.

setZoomLevelLimits.name: setZoomLevelLimits
setZoomLevelLimits.description: Sets the maximum and minimum zoom level.

setSpellCheckProvider.name: setSpellCheckProvider
setSpellCheckProvider.description: Sets a provider for spell checking in input fields and text areas. The provider must be an object that has a spellCheck method that returns whether the word passed is correctly spelled. An example of using node-spellchecker as provider:

registerURLSchemeAsSecure.name: registerURLSchemeAsSecure
registerURLSchemeAsSecure.description: Registers the scheme as secure scheme. Secure schemes do not trigger mixed content warnings. For example, https and data are secure schemes because they cannot be corrupted by active network attackers.

registerURLSchemeAsBypassingCSP.name: registerURLSchemeAsBypassingCSP
registerURLSchemeAsBypassingCSP.description: Resources will be loaded from this scheme regardless of the current page's Content Security Policy.

registerURLSchemeAsPrivileged.name: registerURLSchemeAsPrivileged
registerURLSchemeAsPrivileged.description: Registers the scheme as secure, bypasses content security policy for resources, allows registering ServiceWorker and supports fetch API.

insertText.name: insertText
insertText.description: Inserts text to the focused element.

executeJavaScript.name: executeJavaScript
executeJavaScript.description: Evaluates code in page. In the browser window some HTML APIs like requestFullScreen can only be invoked by a gesture from the user. Setting userGesture to true will remove this limitation.

getResourceUsage.name: getResourceUsage
getResourceUsage.description: Returns an object describing usage information of Blink's internal memory caches. This will generate:

clearCache.name: clearCache
clearCache.description: Attempts to free memory that is no longer being used (like images from a previous navigation). Note that blindly calling this method probably makes Electron slower since it will have to refill these emptied caches, you should only call it if an event in your app has occurred that makes you think your page is actually using less memory (i.e. you have navigated from a super heavy page to a mostly empty one, and intend to stay there).

blur.name: blur
blur.description: Removes focus from the child window.

close.name: close
close.description: Forcefully closes the child window without calling its unload event.

eval.name: eval
eval.description: Evaluates the code in the child window.

focus.name: focus
focus.description: Focuses the child window (brings the window to front).

print.name: print
print.description: Invokes the print dialog on the child window.

postMessage.name: postMessage
postMessage.description: Sends a message to the child window with the specified origin or * for no origin preference. In addition to these methods, the child window implements window.opener object with no properties and a single method.

closed.name: closed
closed.description: A Boolean that is set to true after the child window gets closed.

validStart.name: validStart
validStart.description: Start date of the certificate being valid in seconds

validExpiry.name: validExpiry
validExpiry.description: End date of the certificate being valid in seconds

id.name: id
id.description: Unique identifier associated with the display.

rotation.name: rotation
rotation.description: Can be 0, 90, 180, 270, represents screen rotation in clock-wise degrees.

name.name: name
name.description: Must be set if is , otherwise it should be omitted.

items.name: items
items.description: Array of objects if is or , otherwise it should be omitted.

path.name: path
path.description: Path of the file to open, should only be set if is .

program.name: program
program.description: Path of the program to execute, usually you should specify which opens the current program. Should only be set if is .

args.name: args
args.description: The command line arguments when is executed. Should only be set if is .

title.name: title
title.description: The text to be displayed for the item in the Jump List. Should only be set if is .

description.name: description
description.description: Description of the task (displayed in a tooltip). Should only be set if is .

iconPath.name: iconPath
iconPath.description: The absolute path to an icon to be displayed in a Jump List, which can be an arbitrary resource file that contains an icon (e.g. , , ). You can usually specify to show the program icon.

iconIndex.name: iconIndex
iconIndex.description: The index of the icon in the resource file. If a resource file contains multiple icons this value can be used to specify the zero-based index of the icon that should be displayed for this task. If a resource file contains only one icon, this property should be set to zero.

x.name: x
x.description: The x coordinate of the origin of the rectangle

y.name: y
y.description: The y coordinate of the origin of the rectangle

target.name: target
target.description: The target to launch from this shortcut.

cwd.name: cwd
cwd.description: (optional) - The working directory. Default is empty.

args.name: args
args.description: (optional) - The arguments to be applied to when launching from this shortcut. Default is empty.

description.name: description
description.description: (optional) - The description of the shortcut. Default is empty.

icon.name: icon
icon.description: (optional) - The path to the icon, can be a DLL or EXE. and have to be set together. Default is empty, which uses the target's icon.

iconIndex.name: iconIndex
iconIndex.description: (optional) - The resource ID of icon when is a DLL or EXE. Default is 0.

appUserModelId.name: appUserModelId
appUserModelId.description: (optional) - The Application User Model ID. Default is empty.

program.name: program
program.description: Path of the program to execute, usually you should specify which opens the current program.

arguments.name: arguments
arguments.description: The command line arguments when is executed.

title.name: title
title.description: The string to be displayed in a JumpList.

iconPath.name: iconPath
iconPath.description: The absolute path to an icon to be displayed in a JumpList, which can be an arbitrary resource file that contains an icon. You can usually specify to show the icon of the program.

iconIndex.name: iconIndex
iconIndex.description: The icon index in the icon file. If an icon file consists of two or more icons, set this value to identify the icon. If an icon file consists of one icon, this value is 0.

icon.name: icon
icon.description: The icon showing in thumbnail toolbar.

tooltip.name: tooltip
tooltip.description: (optional) - The text of the button's tooltip.

flags.name: flags
flags.description: (optional) - Control specific states and behaviors of the button. By default, it is .
